result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J Derby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction to be considered if no dirty UA's for 1 year, engage in and complete drug treatment and not be around any drug users.  hearing set for 10/28/16 @ 8:30 a.m.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May Not have contact with anyone who uses or sells drugs.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Fields-Bowers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, the enhancer PTAC is struck.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes and stays a sentence of 9 months jail; deft placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.  Expunction to be considered if no dirty UA's for 1 year, engage in and complete drug treament and not be around any drug users; hearing set for 10/28/16 at 8:30am.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
